oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jewish Community Center, Nashville, Tennessee, 1951
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exterior view of the Jewish Community Center Building (3500 West End Avenue), Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1951. The architectural design was by Hart, Freeland & Roberts. This building was constructed by Foster & Creighton Company. The dedication for the laying of the cornerstone of the Jewish Community Center occurred on September 9, 1951 under the chairmanship of Dr. Sam Riven. The new Center opened in 1952. Forms part of the Foster & Creighton General Contractors Collection. 1 b & w photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jewish Community Center (Nashville, Tenn.)
